body:
Comment 3: 
386 option is for 32-bit version of Windows. amd64 is for 64-bit.

386 tools will build programs on any version, 32-bit and 64-bit, of Windows (because
64-bit version of Windows can execute both 32-bit and 64-bit programs).

Programs built with 386 tools will run on any version, 32-bit and 64-bit, of Windows
(because 64-bit version of Windows can execute both 32-bit and 64-bit programs).

amd64 tools will build programs on 64-bit version of Windows only (because 32-bit
version of Windows can't execute 64-bit programs).

Programs built with amd64 tools will run on 64-bit version of Windows only (because
32-bit version of Windows can't execute 64-bit programs).

If you are still unclear what to choose :-), I suggest you use 386 tools. They will work
everywhere. And you won't have problems running your programs once you copy them to
different computers or give them to your friends.

Alex
